abstract: Family of South Korean pastor and American resident Kim Dong-shik wins $330 million lawsuit against North Korean government for orchestrating Kim's kidnapping and presumed murder in northeastern China in 2000; judgement overturns previous dismissals of case for lack of evidence; North Korea denies involvement and is unlikely to willingly pay.
lead_paragraph: A United States court ordered North Korea to pay $330 million for the abduction and presumed killing of Kim Dong-shik. But Pyongyang is highly unlikely to comply.

headline.main: After 15 Years, Legal Victory for Family of Pastor Believed Abducted by North Korea
headline.print_headline: Legal Victory Over North Korea for Family of Pastor

snippet: A United States court ordered North Korea to pay $330 million for the abduction and presumed killing of Kim Dong-shik. But Pyongyang is highly unlikely to comply.
